review: Chen Zang prepared an exquisite four-course meal for our anniversary dinner. Every dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. He went above and beyond to make the evening special for us. Highly recommend!
description: A classic Chinese soup made with mushrooms, tofu, bamboo shoots, and egg, in a savory and tangy broth.This spicy Sichuan dish features stir-fried chicken, peanuts, and vegetables in a sauce made from chili paste, vinegar, and soy sauce.
cookingMethod_1: A stir-fry dish made with diced chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and spicy Sichuan peppercorns. The chicken is marinated, then stir-fried in a wok with vegetables and spices to create a savory and spicy dish.
cookingMethod_2: A Chinese soup made with a combination of hot and sour flavors, typically featuring ingredients such as bamboo shoots, tofu, mushrooms, vinegar, and chili oil. The soup is typically simmered on the stove to allow the flavors to meld together.
cookingMethod_3: A spicy noodle soup that originated in the Sichuan province of China. It features beef, noodles, vegetables, and a spicy broth made with Sichuan peppercorns, chili oil, and other spices. The beef is typically slow-cooked to tenderize it and infuse it with flavor.

review: Chef Lisa catered our company's holiday party and everyone raved about the food. Her appetizers were especially impressive - unique, creative, and absolutely delicious. She was also very professional and easy to work with.
description: It is a spicy, tangy, and pungent dish that is often used as a condiment or a side dish.
cookingMethod_1: A traditional Korean side dish made from fermented vegetables, typically cabbage, that is seasoned with chili flakes, garlic, and other spices. The vegetables are soaked in a salty brine for several hours, then fermented to create a tangy and spicy dish.
cookingMethod_2: A traditional Chinese dish that involves roasting a whole duck until the skin is crispy and golden brown. The duck is marinated in a mixture of honey, soy sauce, and spices, then roasted in a special oven until the skin is crispy and the meat is tender.
cookingMethod_3: A Chinese cooking method that involves simmering raw ingredients, such as meat, seafood, and vegetables, in a hot and flavorful broth at the table. The ingredients are typically served with dipping sauces and other condiments, allowing diners to customize their dishes.

review: Xiao Liu provided a cooking lesson for my daughter's birthday party and it was such a hit! He taught the kids how to make homemade pasta and a simple tomato sauce, and they all had a blast. He was patient, engaging, and made the experience fun for everyone.

review: Chef Karen helped me plan a surprise dinner for my wife's birthday and it was a huge success. She worked with me to create a menu that incorporated all of my wife's favorite dishes, and the final result was fantastic. Her attention to detail and personalized approach really made the evening special.

review: Chef Marcus was the perfect addition to our family reunion weekend. He cooked all of our meals and each one was better than the last. He also took the time to get to know our family and make sure everyone's dietary needs were accommodated. We can't wait to have him back next year!

review: Chef Sarah catered my wedding and it was absolutely stunning. The food was expertly prepared and presented, and all of our guests were blown away. She also helped me with some last-minute details and was incredibly flexible throughout the planning process. I can't recommend her enough!
